questions.QUESTION: Computing is a set of activities that include:
questions.ANSWERA: performing of calculations or processing of data.
questions.ANSWERB: following a recipe to make biscuits.
questions.ANSWERC: accurate and careful observation of the stars, over a long period of time.
questions.ANSWERD: accurate and careful observation of chemical reactions.

questions.QUESTION: Computational thinking is:
questions.ANSWERA: When computers are solving a difficult problem.
questions.ANSWERB: The process of analyzing problems and challenges and identifying possible solutions to help solve them.
questions.ANSWERC: Using a computer to do lots of math.
questions.ANSWERD: Any activity where a computer and a person work together to do more than either could on their own.

questions.QUESTION: Which method is not a typical part of computational thinking?
Which of these is a good example of decomposition of a problem?
questions.ANSWERA: Splitting the task of designing a robot into designing the hand, designing the power source, deciding on and designing the sensors.
questions.ANSWERB: Slicing a cake into 6 equal slices
questions.ANSWERC: Putting an apple into a glass jar and taking photos of it each day to see what happens.
questions.ANSWERD: Using a search engine to find the answer to a question.

questions.QUESTION: A program is:
questions.ANSWERA: The detailed rules and regulations of a game or sport
questions.ANSWERB: An algorithm expressed in a form that is suitable for a computer
questions.ANSWERC: The collection of laws and regulations that determine what buildings can be built legally at a particular place.
questions.ANSWERD: A sequence of instructions for a person to follow, e.g. a recipe for baking a cake.

questions.QUESTION: Which of these is least likely to be a way that algorithms are used in computational thinking?
questions.ANSWERA: An algorithm may lead to a computer program that when run solves the problem
questions.ANSWERB: An algorithm may lead to a computer program that employs intuition to derive better solutions.
questions.ANSWERC: An algorithm may provide a step by step guide for manufacturing something.
questions.ANSWERD: An algorithm may provide a step by step guide for processes involving people, money and resources.

questions.QUESTION: For designing a program for cooking for a robot chef to use, which of the following would be the most relevant detail?
questions.ANSWERB: What quantities of each ingredient to use.
questions.ANSWERC: Which shop the ingredients were bought from.
questions.ANSWERD: Whether the programmer is right or left handed.

questions.QUESTION: A formal language is:
questions.ANSWERA: A language in which it is not possible to make a mistake.
questions.ANSWERB: A language with defined rules and unambiguous meanings
questions.ANSWERC: The best language to use when writing a postcard.
questions.ANSWERD: Any language that has the words "and" and "or" in it.

questions.QUESTION: English, Arabic and Chinese are:
Machine code is:
questions.ANSWERA: Translated into source code so that a computer can obey the instructions.
questions.ANSWERB: A method for secure communication between two computers.
questions.ANSWERC: The 1’s and 0’s that a computer obeys.
questions.ANSWERD: A written agreement between a programmer and a customer specifying what a program should do.

questions.QUESTION: An algorithm written in the java computer language is an example of:
A program specification is:
questions.ANSWERA: The code that the computer runs.
questions.ANSWERB: The comments in code that a programmer reads.
questions.ANSWERC: The actual electrical signals in a computer, when a program is running.
questions.ANSWERD: A description of what a program should do that is used during designing the program.

questions.QUESTION: A sequence is:
questions.ANSWERA: A number of instructions that can be obeyed in any order.
questions.ANSWERB: A number of instructions that should be obeyed one after the other.
questions.ANSWERC: An analysis of a problem to be solved.
questions.ANSWERD: A collection of recommendations for enhancing a computer program.

questions.QUESTION: Which of these is not used to represent an algorithm?
Which of the following commands is used to display the result of a calculation?
Which statement about variables is correct?
questions.ANSWERB: A variable name must use lower case letters only.
questions.ANSWERC: Variables must be initialized to zero.
questions.ANSWERD: Sometimes a variable can hold a Boolean value.

questions.QUESTION: What is the purpose of a variable?
questions.ANSWERA: To make it easier to change a program in the future.
questions.ANSWERB: To tell Java how to combine two numbers
questions.ANSWERC: To remember some value that will be used again later in the program.
questions.ANSWERD: To ensure that the source code is indented correctly

questions.QUESTION: A data type which has only two values is called:
An ArrayList variable can hold:
questions.ANSWERA: Just a single number between -128 and 128.
questions.ANSWERB: A video file in the format normally used for display on a computer.
questions.ANSWERC: An audio file in the format normally used for ring tones.
questions.ANSWERD: An ArrayList of student names that can be sorted using the method Collections.sort().

questions.QUESTION: A comment in a computer program is:
questions.ANSWERB: Anything in the code that is before a procedure
questions.ANSWERD: Text to help document the program.

questions.QUESTION: You should use a comment:
questions.ANSWERA: After every single line in a program.
questions.ANSWERB: Before every single line in a program.
questions.ANSWERC: To make it easier for someone else to understand your program.
questions.ANSWERD: Only for the most difficult method in a program.

questions.QUESTION: Variable names should be:
questions.ANSWERA: Short to make the program as fast as possible.
questions.ANSWERB: At least eight letters long, so that other people wont be able to guess them.
questions.ANSWERC: Made from letters and numbers, not just letters.
questions.ANSWERD: Chosen to make your program more easily understood.

questions.QUESTION: Java blocks of code are indicated by:
questions.ANSWERB: Starting them with { and ending them with } and indenting the block of code.
questions.ANSWERC: Starting them with ( and ending them with )

questions.QUESTION: A Java conditional statement:
questions.ANSWERC: Is a special kind of comment saying what conditions the code should be used in.
questions.ANSWERD: Is a special kind of procedure that may in some conditions be a method instead.

questions.ANSWERA: Both the first and second indented block will always be run.
questions.ANSWERB: Neither the first nor the second indented block will ever be run
questions.ANSWERC: There is a logic error because you cannot use .equals with a string.
questions.ANSWERD: The first or second indented block may be run.  Which one runs depends on the value of password.

questions.QUESTION: What is the main purpose of a loop?
questions.ANSWERA: To stop the computer running off the end of a program.
questions.ANSWERB: To go back to the beginning of a program.
questions.ANSWERC: To connect one computer to another.

questions.QUESTION: A loop that goes on forever is called?
To count through several items, we typically use:
To repeat some action several times without counting we typically use:
A typical method in Java:
questions.ANSWERA: Starts with the keyword static and datatype and finally provides some code that returns a value
questions.ANSWERB: Starts with the keyword abc and provides some code that returns a value
questions.ANSWERC: Is a named piece of code that does a number of things and then stops the program.
questions.ANSWERD: Is a named piece of code that does a number of things and then restarts the NetBeans IDE.

questions.QUESTION: A void method in Java:
questions.ANSWERA: Consists of pseudocode which isn’t meant for the computer to run.
questions.ANSWERB: Consists entirely of comments specifying what the program is intended to do.
questions.ANSWERD: Is like a typical method, but does not return a value.

questions.QUESTION: A parameter is:
questions.ANSWERA: A value which is passed into a void method or a typical method for it to use
questions.ANSWERB: A way of measuring distance approximately, that can make some code simpler.
questions.ANSWERC: A way for a program to do several things at the same time.
questions.ANSWERD: A block of code with a specified number of lines to it.

questions.QUESTION: The method max() is found in which library?
The string named greeting has the value "Good".  Which command sets it to have the value "Good Morning"?
A recursive algorithm is one that:
questions.ANSWERA: Calculates the exponential of a number.
questions.ANSWERC: Uses random numbers to solve a problem.
questions.ANSWERD: Breaks a problem into smaller pieces, and then applies the same approach to those smaller pieces.

questions.QUESTION: An infinite loop is:
questions.ANSWERD: A recursive function that draws circles.

questions.QUESTION: Program testing is:
questions.ANSWERA: Checking with the customer that the specification is what they want.
questions.ANSWERB: Fixing a bug when a user reports an error.
questions.ANSWERC: When someone who has more experience has a look at the source code for a program and helps improve it.
questions.ANSWERD: A formal approach to finding bugs in a program, by running the program with different inputs.

questions.QUESTION: Debugging is:
questions.ANSWERA: Checking a program against its requirements to see if it does what it is supposed to do.
questions.ANSWERB: Enhancing a program by adding new features.
questions.ANSWERC: Work done to track down the cause of a problem and fix it.
questions.ANSWERD: Enhancing a program by taking out features which aren’t needed anymore.

questions.QUESTION: One of the initial requirement for a particular program is that it ask for and remember your name. Which of the following would you expect to see in the code to help meet that requirement?
questions.ANSWERD: Code to convert a string to an integer.

questions.QUESTION: A software company wants to make incremental improvements to version 1 of its program for managing recipes.   Which of the following is a good way to identify possible enhancements?
questions.ANSWERA: Add code for drawing a fern recursively.
questions.ANSWERB: Use Google to search for "robots AND cooking"
questions.ANSWERC: Look for small changes that would make the program useful to more people.
questions.ANSWERD: Design a massive overhaul of the program to implement as many changes as possible.

questions.QUESTION: When describing the commercial value of a new program, the best way is:
questions.ANSWERA: Show as detailed a flowchart as possible to show how complex the program is.
questions.ANSWERB: Describe the benefit to users and back it up with numerical data if you can.
questions.ANSWERC: Explain that the program is new, and therefore it must be of value.
questions.ANSWERD: Explain that it uses only well known, widely used, reliable algorithms.

questions.QUESTION: Computing is defined as:
questions.ANSWERA: Any goal-oriented activity requiring, benefiting from, or creating computers
questions.ANSWERB: An algorithm that uniquely represents symbols from some source alphabet, which may be in some other target alphabet
questions.ANSWERC: A deliberate process that transforms one or more inputs into one or more results, with variable change
questions.ANSWERD: A process of discovering and resolving defects that prevent correct operation of computer software or a system

questions.QUESTION: Which of the following is a typical activity in the creation of a program?

questions.ANSWERC: any methods’ names are used to distinguish easily

questions.ANSWERB: A constructor generated by the java compiler that is invisible in a class and does not have any parameters
questions.ANSWERC: he first constructor in a class, implemented by the user
questions.ANSWERD: A constructor generated by the java compiler that receives a single parameter

questions.QUESTION: Assume you have two classes, named myOb1 and myOb2.  What kind of relationship do these objects share, when myOb1 holds an instance of myOb2, called a, but acan live on after the destruction of the myOb1’s instance?

questions.ANSWERD: The ability of an object to take on a single form

questions.QUESTION: We cannot override Private methods This statement about inheritance is:

questions.ANSWERC: Class that when compiled does not produce a .class file
questions.ANSWERD: Collection of constants and method declarations

questions.QUESTION: A __________ access modifier can be used as an interface.

questions.ANSWERA: A centralized version control system that requires developers to work on a project with a single authoritative data store
questions.ANSWERB: A hosted and distributed continuous integration service used to build and test software projects
questions.ANSWERC: A text editor designed specifically for editing source code and it may be built into an integrated development environment (IDE)
questions.ANSWERD: A distributed version control system that allows developers to work on a project without requiring a single authoritative data store
